entry.title: Bitcoin ETF Deadline Looms: It's 'All Systems Go', Say Analysts
entry.summary: Analysts say they expect the SEC to put out a statement—an official one, this time—late in the afternoon on Wednesday.

entry.title: U.S. Senators Demand Explanation for SEC's Fake Bitcoin ETF Approval Tweet
entry.summary: Senators JD Vance (R-OH) and Thom Tillis (R-N.C.) wrote to "express concern and request clarity" regarding the SEC's social media blunder.

entry.title: Twitter Safety: ‘Compromised’ SEC Account Posted Fake Bitcoin ETF Tweet, Didn’t Enable 2FA
entry.summary: Twitter confirmed the regulator's account was compromised after a third party obtained control over a phone number associated with it.

entry.title: Crypto Degens Are Betting Millions on a Bitcoin ETF Being Approved
entry.summary: How strongly do you believe that a spot Bitcoin ETF will be approved in the U.S. this week? Some traders are betting on it—literally.

entry.title: SEC and Twitter Announce Investigations Into Fake Bitcoin ETF Tweet
entry.summary: The regulatory agency says it has terminated "unauthorized access" to its Twitter account.

entry.title: Game On: The Hottest Upcoming Gaming Token Airdrops
entry.summary: UPDATED: The Xai airdrop on Arbitrum is live, while Pixels and Saga have revealed new details and Notcoin is teasing a token drop.

entry.title: Gensler's ‘Compromised’ Bitcoin ETF Tweet Inscribed as an Ordinals NFT
entry.summary: A fake tweet sent Bitcoin’s price tumbling. Degens immortalized the SEC chair’s response as digital art.

entry.title: Solana's SAMO Meme Coin Spikes 24% Amid Airdrop for Saga Phone Owners
entry.summary: Another day, another exclusive benefit for Solana Saga phone buyers. This time, it’s an airdrop of Samoyedcoin (SAMO).

entry.title: AI Voice Actors Are Coming to Video Games Thanks to SAG-AFTRA Deal
entry.summary: Instead of fighting against generative AI in games, SAG-AFTRA has signed an agreement with one company to moderate its use.

entry.title: Bitcoin Plunges After 'Compromised' SEC Twitter Account Tweets Fake ETF Approval
entry.summary: Bitcoin briefly hit a two-year high after apparent news of a spot ETF approval, but the price fell sharply after it was revealed to be false.

entry.title: SEC Twitter Account Hacked, Sends False 'Bitcoin ETFs Approved' Tweet
entry.summary: "The SEC has not approved the listing and trading of spot bitcoin exchange-traded products," SEC Chair Gary Gensler said on Tuesday afternoon.

entry.title: OpenAI Under Scrutiny as EU Unpacks Microsoft Deal
entry.summary: European regulators are looking into whether Microsoft's $10 billion investment in OpenAI has antitrust ramifications.

entry.title: Trillions of 'Notcoin' Farmed in Telegram Meme Coin Game—But There's a Catch
entry.summary: Telegram's Notcoin clicker game looks like a gateway to free crypto. However, the meme coin isn't real yet—but an airdrop could be coming.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETFs Will Not Be a ‘Winner-Take-All Market’: VanEck CEO
entry.summary: With SEC approval widely anticipated tomorrow, Jan van Eck predicts trading will start Thursday for Bitcoin ETFs.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETF May Actually Boost BTC Price as Analysts Flip on 'Sell the News' Fears
entry.summary: Analysts at K33 Research had previously said they expected the approval of a spot Bitcoin ETF to trigger a "sell the news" event. Not anymore.

entry.title: XAI Airdrop on Arbitrum Puts $70 Million Into Gamers' Wallets
entry.summary: Arbitrum’s new “layer-3” gaming network Xai launches the XAI token, hitting a market cap above $154 million after the airdrop.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETF: These Are All the Authorized Participants
entry.summary: Authorized participants are needed to provide the liquidity in the ETF market, and their bona fides are very important to the SEC.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETFs Have Been Trading Around the World for Years—Here’s How They’ve Done
entry.summary: Brazil shines, Canada leads, and the U.S. teeters on the edge of history.

entry.title: SEC Provides Comments on Latest Bitcoin ETF Filings: Report
entry.summary: Prospective Bitcoin ETF issuers are reportedly set to file updated documents Tuesday, responding to a round of comments from the SEC Monday.

entry.title: ‘Not Telling The Full Story’: OpenAI Challenges NYT's Copyright Lawsuit Claims
entry.summary: OpenAI says the New York Times cherry picked responses and manipulated prompts to make its chatbot “regurgitate” content.

entry.title: Bitcoin Could Hit $200,000 by December 2025, Says Standard Chartered Bank
entry.summary: SCB analysts join Bloomberg in predicting a six-figure Bitcoin price.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETF Fee War: Here's What's Going On
entry.summary: Potential Bitcoin ETF issuers may be playing chicken with one another, seeing who can sustain the lowest fees for longest.

entry.title: VanEck, Bitwise Prep Over $200 Million in Advance of Bitcoin ETF Approval
entry.summary: With Bitcoin spot ETFs imminent, the financial firms are poised to inject millions into the new investment vehicle.

entry.title: Ubisoft Will Tap NVIDIA's AI Tools to Build Chatty Game Characters
entry.summary: Ubisoft and Tencent are embracing generative AI. But will the new tech make games better?

entry.title: Someone Sent $1.2 Million in Bitcoin to Satoshi's Wallet—Why?
entry.summary: Theories have abounded as to the mystery payer’s identity, with some more plausible than others.

entry.title: Don't Underestimate Mobile Gaming: Qualcomm's Matthew Grossman
entry.summary: Qualcomm product marketing manager Matthew Grossman tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin why mobile esports is exploding in popularity around the world—and dispels some of the misconceptions around mobile gaming.

entry.title: Bitcoin Devs Preserve Classic Nintendo Games With Ordinals
entry.summary: Leaping well beyond monkey JPEGs, Ninjalerts has inscribed a Super Nintendo Entertainment System emulator on a satoshi.

entry.title: Gary Gensler Again Warns Against Investing in Crypto as Market Awaits Bitcoin ETF
entry.summary: The SEC chair warned of risks in crypto investments, highlighting compliance issues and volatility as several Bitcoin ETFs await SEC approval.

entry.title: Bitcoin Reclaims $45,000 As ETF Hopefuls Make Final Filings
entry.summary: Bitcoin has recovered the losses from last week's flash crash, as firms made their final amendments to their spot Bitcoin ETF applications.

entry.title: BlackRock, VanEck, WisdomTree Reveal Bitcoin ETF Fees in Amended S-1 Filings
entry.summary: Bitcoin ETF hopefuls have filed a rush of amended S-1 forms as they race to meet the SEC's final deadline Monday.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETF Approval Odds Raised to 95%: Bloomberg Analyst
entry.summary: A Bloomberg Intelligence analyst puts the odds of a Bitcoin ETF being approved in January at 95%, as crunch time looms for the SEC's decision.

entry.title: Transformed, Not Terminated: AI Researchers Weigh In on the Future
entry.summary: A large-scale survey of artificial intelligence researchers found few worried about extinction, but many sounding the alarm over employment.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: ETF Fever Won’t Break
entry.summary: Rumors and predictions about a looming spot Bitcoin ETF approval ran rampant this week, spiking nerves and crypto prices alike.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETFs Take a Big Step Toward Approval, Analysts Say
entry.summary: BlackRock's application led the way on Friday, as an ETF analyst predicted that we could see a $100 billion Bitcoin ETF in as little as five years.

entry.title: Report Crypto Trades Over $10K to IRS or Face Jail? It’s Complicated
entry.summary: A new tax law appears to have massive implications for crypto users. But who it might affect, and when, is not so straightforward.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETF: This Is the 'Calm Before the Storm', Says ETF Analyst
entry.summary: Bloomberg Senior ETF Analyst Eric Balchunas joins Farokh Sarmad, Michael Anderson, and Ovie Faruq on the FOMO Hour to share the latest intel on the looming approval for a spot Bitcoin ETF, what might happen when the very different worlds of TradFi and crypto collide, and his insights on “Genslish,” the unique and strategic language of SEC chair Gary Gensler.

entry.title: Pixels Game Airdrop Announced—Here’s How to Get Pixel Tokens
entry.summary: Airdrops continue to keep crypto believers enthralled, further fueled by Pixels’ latest announcement.

entry.title: Anthropic Says It Won’t Use Your Private Data to Train Its AI
entry.summary: As AI companies hungrily consume every trove of data they can find, the makers of Claude.AI say they won’t their its own customers' work to improve its chatbot.

entry.title: 'Bitcoin's Time Has Arrived': ETF Hopefuls Eagerly Await SEC Decision
entry.summary: ETF hopeful Hashdex releases a Bitcoin advert as analysts speculate that the SEC’s decision on Bitcoin ETFs may be imminent.

entry.title: Celsius to Unstake $466 Million Ethereum Holdings, 'Ensure Ample Liquidity' for Creditors
entry.summary: Celsius accounts for almost a third of ETH awaiting withdrawal, as it begins "recalling and rebalancing assets" ahead of asset distributions.

entry.title: Saga Airdrop Coming Ahead of Blockchain Launch—Here’s Who Is Eligible
entry.summary: Some Polygon, Avalanche, Cosmos, and Celestia users will be included in Saga’s community token airdrop.

entry.summary:
This week our host is joined by Brooke Lacey!
They discuss: - Making and losing generational wealth - Trauma Bond - Women in Web3 - The Problem with WAGMI

entry.title: ESL Faceit Group Exploring Blockchain 'Opportunistically,' Says Exec
entry.summary: Sam Braithwaite—ESL Faceit Group's VP of Game Ecosystems, Mobile, and Snapdragon Pro Series—shares the esports firm's approach to blockchain technology with GG's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Bryan Johnson Explains His Quest for Immortality and Why He Started with the Penis
entry.summary: Billionaire biohacker Bryan Johnson shared with Decrypt's Jason Nelson why he began his longevity quest and how technology has shaped the endeavor. Johnson also discusses some of his controversial experiments.

entry.title: Wildcard's Plans for 2024 with Founders Paul and Katy Bettner
entry.summary: Wildcard developers Paul and Katy Bettner tell Decrypt's Kate Irwin about why they see their game as a "Web3 game," not a crypto game, and share why they've stuck with their initial vision despite the challenging broader market.

entry.title: Decrypt and Rug Radio Merge to Create Global Web3 Publishing Company
entry.summary: Decrypt and Rug Radio have announced their intent to merge, creating the world’s biggest decentralized publishing company. Codenamed [REDACTED], the alliance is aimed at revolutionizing tech-media, bringing together the forces of content creation and consumption.

entry.title: 'If You Play Well, You're Gonna be Rewarded': How FPS Web3War is Bringing 'Skill-to-Earn' to Crypto Gaming
entry.summary: Roll1ng Thund3rz co-founder Valentin Cobelea and Zilliqa CEO Matt Dyer joined Decrypt to discuss how the new FPS game Web3War is shaking up the crypto gaming space with a novel "skill to earn" mechanic that rewards players for high-quality gameplay.
